cause.description:
One World Youth Project (OWYP) is a unique educational Project-pair program that connects High Schools and Youth Groups for the purpose of cultural exchange and collaborative community service toward the achievement of the United Nations Millennium Development Goals.
Through its unique curriculum that encourages cultural exchange and service learning, OWYP creates global communities while strengthening local communities because it recognizes that one's existence in a global community of shared challenges at a young age promotes a future of cross-cultural collaboration.
Young people build leadership skills and are empowered to create a lasting, positive impact in their communities. It is our belief that recognizing one’s existence in a global community of shared challenges at a young age, promotes a future of cross-cultural collaboration. OWYP was founded by youth and remains entirely run by a staff of young people.
1. Through participating in cultural exchange, youth are inspired to take positive action.
